metadata.title: CVE-2020-13164 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In Wireshark 3.2.0 to 3.2.3, 3.0.0 to 3.0.10, and 2.6.0 to 2.6.16, the NFSdissector could crash. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-nfs.cby preventing excessive recursion, such as for a cycle in the directorygraph on a filesystem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13164` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.10-1~ubuntu16.04.0+esm1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.10-1~ubuntu16.04.0+esm1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.10-1~ubuntu16.04.0+esm1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.10-1~ubuntu16.04.0+esm1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.10-1~ubuntu16.04.0+esm1
tshark - 2.6.10-1~ubuntu16.04.0+esm1
wireshark - 2.6.10-1~ubuntu16.04.0+esm1
wireshark-common - 2.6.10-1~ubuntu16.04.0+esm1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.10-1~ubuntu16.04.0+esm1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.10-1~ubuntu16.04.0+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.10-1~ubuntu16.04.0+esm1').
